Package com.api.hub.ai.cache.impl

Class CacheRefresher

java.lang.Object
com.api.hub.ai.cache.impl.CacheRefresher
All Implemented Interfaces:
MarkerConstants
@Component @ConditionalOnProperty(name={"cache.enabled","cache.default.refresher.enabled"}, havingValue="true") public class CacheRefresher extends Object implements MarkerConstants
A scheduled component responsible for managing and refreshing multiple cache instances within the AI-Agent Execution and Orchestration Platform.

This class maintains a registry of caches implementing CacheOperations interface and periodically triggers their refresh processes based on configurable time intervals. It ensures that all registered caches stay synchronized and up-to-date with their external or underlying cache sources, improving cache consistency across the framework.

Refresh operations are performed only if the minimum configured refresh interval has elapsed since the last refresh of each cache instance, preventing excessive refreshes.

This class is enabled conditionally via Spring properties:

  • cache.enabled=true
  • cache.default.refresher.enabled=true

If these properties are not set, the refresher will not be initialized.

Configuration properties:

  • cache.min.refreshTime.ms - minimum time in milliseconds between successive refreshes for a cache (default: 5000 ms)
  • cache.refreshTime.sec - interval in seconds at which the scheduled refresh runs (default: 300 seconds)

Typical usage involves calling registerCache(CacheOperations) during cache initialization to include the cache instance in the periodic refresh cycle.

See Also:
  • CacheOperations

  • Method Details

    • registerCache

      public void registerCache(@NonNull @NonNull CacheOperations<?,?> cache)
      Registers a cache instance implementing CacheOperations for periodic refresh.
      Parameters:
      cache - the cache instance to register, must not be null

    • refresh

      @Scheduled(fixedDelayString="${cache.refreshTime.sec:300}", timeUnit=SECONDS) public boolean refresh()
      Scheduled method triggered periodically based on the configured fixed delay (default 300 seconds).

      For each registered cache, this method checks if the minimum refresh interval has passed since the last refresh. If yes, it calls CacheOperations.clear() followed by CacheOperations.refresh() to update the cache contents.

      Returns:
      true indicating the refresh cycle completed
